definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: As requested by a disciple one poem is written in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應一弟子提請，一詩作已手書成。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Hai Ying below I had written the name of the seal in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子海鸚如下的提請，我已手書一法印的名稱了。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Jing Xing below I had written the long mantra of Vaishravana Heavenly King in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子敬行以下之提請，我已手書了北方天王的長咒。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Jing Xing below I had written one poem by Guru Chen in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子敬行以下的提請我己手書了陳上師的一首詩作。

sentences.english: Both Chinese and English version of the supplication and my calligraphy of it are attached.
sentences.chinese: 中英文版的祈請頌及我的手書均附呈。

sentences.english: Disciple Hong Fu asked me to give her study a name and write calligraphy for it.
sentences.chinese: 弟子虹福請我爲她的書齋取個名併爲之手書翰墨。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Hai Ying below, I had written a Dharma sentence into calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子海鸚以下的提請，我已將一法句手書成翰墨。

sentences.english: Disciple Ci Du asked me to write his Dharma name in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 弟子慈渡請我手書他的法名。

sentences.english: I have written the phrase I use to express Bodhicitta in calligraphy; it is attached.
sentences.chinese: 我已手書了我通常用以表達菩提心的句子，檔案附呈。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Jing Xing below I had written the poem by Guru Chen in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子敬行以下之提請，我已手書了陳上師之此詩作。

sentences.english: These second hand books are as good as new.
sentences.chinese: 這些二手書的狀態良好，像新的一樣。

sentences.english: It involves customers mailing their used books for me to purchase.
sentences.chinese: 它涉及到客戶的二手書郵寄給我購買。

sentences.english: My wife likes this poem, so she asked me to write it.
sentences.chinese: 由於內人喜歡此詩作，所以她請我手書它。

sentences.english: Upon request from disciple Mian Yan I had written the Heart Mantra of Guru Rinpoche in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 應來自弟子綿延之請，我已手書蓮師心咒。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Boon Eng of Malaysia a while ago, I did the calligraphy today.
sentences.chinese: 應馬來西亞弟子文英之前的提請，我已於今日手書成。

sentences.english: I remember searching notice boards for second-hand books and borrowing lunch money.
sentences.chinese: 我記得在告示板上巡睃着二手書還有借買午餐的錢。

definition: to write a letter (to the authorities)/to present a petition
imperial edict/heavenly book (superstition)/obscure or illegible writing/double dutch
to write the title of a book on a label
